auxiliary_tenant_ids.description: The Auxiliary Tenant IDs which should be used.

azure_devops_service_connection_id.description: The Azure DevOps Service Connection ID that uses Workload Identity Federation.

client_certificate.description: Base64 encoded PKCS#12 certificate bundle. For use when authenticating as a Service Principal using a Client Certificate.

client_certificate_file_path.description: The path to the Client Certificate associated with the Service Principal for use when authenticating as a Service Principal using a Client Certificate.

client_certificate_password.description: The password associated with the Client Certificate. For use when authenticating as a Service Principal using a Client Certificate.

client_id.description: The Client ID of the app registration.

client_id_file_path.description: The path to a file containing the Client ID which should be used.

client_secret.description: The Client Secret of the app registration. For use when authenticating as a Service Principal using a Client Secret.

client_secret_file_path.description: The path to a file containing the Client Secret which should be used. For use when authenticating as a Service Principal using a Client Secret.

disable_terraform_partner_id.description: Disable sending the Terraform Partner ID if a custom `partner_id` isn't specified, which allows Microsoft to better understand the usage of Terraform. The Partner ID does not give HashiCorp any direct access to usage information. This can also be sourced from the `FABRIC_DISABLE_TERRAFORM_PARTNER_ID` environment variable. Defaults to `false`.

endpoint.description: The Endpoint of the Microsoft Fabric API.

environment.description: The cloud environment which should be used. Possible values are 'public', 'usgovernment' and 'china'. Defaults to 'public'

oidc_request_token.description: The bearer token for the request to the OIDC provider. For use when authenticating as a Service Principal using OpenID Connect.

oidc_request_url.description: The URL for the OIDC provider from which to request an ID token. For use when authenticating as a Service Principal using OpenID Connect.

oidc_token.description: The OIDC token for use when authenticating as a Service Principal using OpenID Connect.

oidc_token_file_path.description: The path to a file containing an OIDC token for use when authenticating as a Service Principal using OpenID Connect.

partner_id.description: A GUID/UUID that is [registered](https://learn.microsoft.com/partner-center/marketplace-offers/azure-partner-customer-usage-attribution#register-guids-and-offers) with Microsoft to facilitate partner resource usage attribution.

preview.description: Enable preview mode to use preview features.

tenant_id.description: The ID of the Microsoft Entra ID tenant that Fabric API uses to authenticate with.

timeout.description:
Default timeout for all requests. It can be overridden at any Resource/Data-Source
   A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as `30s` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours)
   If not set, the default timeout is `10m`.

use_cli.description: Allow Azure CLI to be used for authentication.

use_dev_cli.description: Allow Azure Developer CLI to be used for authentication.

use_msi.description: Allow Managed Service Identity (MSI) to be used for authentication.

use_oidc.description: Allow OpenID Connect to be used for authentication.

definition_update_enabled.description: Update definition on change of source content. Default: `true`.

-> This resource supports Service Principal authentication.

allow_connection_usage_in_gateway.description: Allow this connection to be utilized with either on-premises data gateways or VNet data gateways. If the value of [`connectivity_type`](#connectivity_type) attribute is `VirtualNetworkGateway` this attribute is **NULL**.

creation_method.description: (ForceNew) The creation method used to create the connection.

data_type.description: The data type of the parameter.

name.description: (ForceNew) The name of the parameter.

value.description: (ForceNew) The value of the parameter.

parameters.description: (ForceNew) A set of connection parameters.

type.description: (ForceNew) The type of the connection.

connectivity_type.description: (ForceNew) The Connection connectivity type. Value must be one of : `ShareableCloud`, `VirtualNetworkGateway`.

basic_credentials.description: The basic credentials. If the value of [`<.credential_type`](#<.credential_type) attribute is `Basic` this attribute is **REQUIRED**.

connection_encryption.description: The connection encryption type. Value defaults to `NotEncrypted`. Value must be one of : `Any`, `Encrypted`, `NotEncrypted`.

credential_type.description: The credential type. Value must be one of : `Anonymous`, `Basic`, `Key`, `OAuth2`, `ServicePrincipal`, `SharedAccessSignature`, `Windows`, `WindowsWithoutImpersonation`, `WorkspaceIdentity`.

key_credentials.description: The key credentials. If the value of [`<.credential_type`](#<.credential_type) attribute is `Key` this attribute is **REQUIRED**.

service_principal_credentials.description: The service principal credentials. If the value of [`<.credential_type`](#<.credential_type) attribute is `ServicePrincipal` this attribute is **REQUIRED**.

shared_access_signature_credentials.description: The shared access signature credentials. If the value of [`<.credential_type`](#<.credential_type) attribute is `SharedAccessSignature` this attribute is **REQUIRED**.

single_sign_on_type.description: The single sign-on type. Value defaults to `None`. Value must be one of : `Kerberos`, `KerberosDirectQueryAndRefresh`, `MicrosoftEntraID`, `None`, `SecurityAssertionMarkupLanguage`.

skip_test_connection.description: Whether the connection should skip the test connection during creation and update. `True` - Skip the test connection, `False` - Do not skip the test connection. Value defaults to `false`.

display_name.description: The Connection display name. String length must be at most 123.

gateway_id.description: (ForceNew) The Connection gateway object ID. If the value of [`connectivity_type`](#connectivity_type) attribute is `VirtualNetworkGateway` this attribute is **REQUIRED**. If the value of [`connectivity_type`](#connectivity_type) attribute is `ShareableCloud` this attribute is **NULL**.

privacy_level.description: The Connection privacy level. Value defaults to `Organizational`. Value must be one of : `None`, `Organizational`, `Private`, `Public`.

create.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

capacity_id.description: The capacity ID. If the value of [`type`](#type) attribute is `VirtualNetwork` this attribute is **REQUIRED**. If the value of [`type`](#type) attribute is one of `OnPremises` or `OnPremisesPersonal` this attribute is **NULL**.

display_name.description: The Gateway display name. String length must be at most 200. If the value of [`type`](#type) attribute is one of `OnPremises` or `VirtualNetwork` this attribute is **REQUIRED**. If the value of [`type`](#type) attribute is `OnPremisesPersonal` this attribute is **NULL**.

If the value of [`type`](#type) attribute is `VirtualNetwork` this attribute is **REQUIRED**. load_balancing_setting.description: The load balancing setting. Value must be one of : `DistributeEvenly`, `Failover`.

number_of_member_gateways.description: The number of member gateways. Value must be between 1 and 7. If the value of [`type`](#type) attribute is `VirtualNetwork` this attribute is **REQUIRED**. database_type.description:
The type of the KQL database. Accepted values: `ReadWrite`, `Shortcut`.

`ReadWrite` Allows read and write operations on the database.

`Shortcut` A shortcut is an embedded reference allowing read only operations on a source database. The source can be in the same or different tenants, either in an Azure Data Explorer cluster or a Fabric Eventhouse.

invitation_token.description: Invitation token to follow the source database. Only allowed when `database_type` is `Shortcut`.

invitation_token_wo.description: Invitation token (WO) to follow the source database. Only allowed when `database_type` is `Shortcut`.

source_cluster_uri.description: The URI of the source Eventhouse or Azure Data Explorer cluster. Only allowed when `database_type` is `Shortcut`.

source_database_name.description: The name of the database to follow in the source Eventhouse or Azure Data Explorer cluster. Only allowed when `database_type` is `Shortcut`.

name.description: (ForceNew) Name of the shortcut.

path.description: (ForceNew) A string representing the full path where the shortcut is created, including either "Files" or "Tables". String length must be at most 256. Shortcut path can't start with forward slash '/'.

connection_id.description: A string representing the connection that is bound with the shortcut. The connectionId is a unique identifier used to establish a connection between the shortcut and the target datasource. To find this connection ID, first create a cloud connection to be used by the shortcut when connecting to the ADLS data location. Open the cloud connection's Settings view and copy the connection ID; this is a GUID.

location.description: Specifies the location of the target ADLS container. The URI must be in the format https://[account-name].dfs.core.windows.net where [account-name] is the name of the target ADLS account.

subpath.description: Specifies the container and subfolder within the ADLS account where the target folder is located. Must be of the format [container]/[subfolder] where [container] is the name of the container that holds the files and folders; [subfolder] is the name of the subfolder within the container (optional). For example: /mycontainer/mysubfolder.

adls_gen2.description: An object containing the properties of the target ADLS Gen2 data source.

connection_id.description: A string representing the connection that is bound with the shortcut. The connectionId is a unique identifier used to establish a connection between the shortcut and the target datasource. To find this connection ID, first create a cloud connection to be used by the shortcut when connecting to the Amazon S3 data location. Open the cloud connection's Settings view and copy the connection ID; this is a GUID.

location.description: HTTP URL that points to the target bucket in S3. The URL should be in the format https://[bucket-name].s3.[region-code].amazonaws.com, where 'bucket-name' is the name of the S3 bucket you want to point to, and 'region-code' is the code for the region where the bucket is located. For example: https://my-s3-bucket.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com.

subpath.description: Specifies a target folder or subfolder within the S3 bucket.

amazon_s3.description: An object containing the properties of the target Amazon S3 data source.

connection_id.description: A string representing the connection that is bound with the shortcut. The connectionId is a unique identifier used to establish a connection between the shortcut and the target datasource.

location.description: HTTP URL that points to the target bucket in GCS. The URL should be in the format https://[bucket-name].storage.googleapis.com, where [bucket-name] is the name of the bucket you want to point to. For example: https://my-gcs-bucket.storage.googleapis.com.

subpath.description: Specifies a target folder or subfolder within the GCS bucket. For example: /folder.

azure_blob_storage.description: An object containing the properties of the target Google Cloud Storage data source.

connection_id.description: A string representing the connection that is bound with the shortcut. The connectionId is a unique identifier used to establish a connection between the shortcut and the target datasource. To find this connection ID, first create a cloud connection to be used by the shortcut when connecting to the Dataverse data location. Open the cloud connection's Settings view and copy the connection ID; this is a GUID.

deltalake_folder.description: Specifies the DeltaLake folder path where the target data is stored.

environment_domain.description: URI that indicates the Dataverse target environment's domain name. The URI should be formatted as 'https://[orgname].crm[xx].dynamics.com', where [orgname] represents the name of your Dataverse organization.

table_name.description: Specifies the name of the target table in Dataverse.

dataverse.description: An object containing the properties of the target Dataverse data source.

connection_id.description: A string representing the connection that is bound with the shortcut. The connectionId is a unique identifier used to establish a connection between the shortcut and the target datasource.

external_data_share.description: An object containing the properties of the target external data share.

connection_id.description: A string representing the connection that is bound with the shortcut. The connectionId is a unique identifier used to establish a connection between the shortcut and the target datasource.

location.description: HTTP URL that points to the target bucket in GCS. The URL should be in the format https://[bucket-name].storage.googleapis.com, where [bucket-name] is the name of the bucket you want to point to. For example: https://my-gcs-bucket.storage.googleapis.com.

subpath.description: Specifies a target folder or subfolder within the GCS bucket. For example: /folder.

google_cloud_storage.description: An object containing the properties of the target Google Cloud Storage data source.

item_id.description: The ID of the target in OneLake. The target can be an item of Lakehouse, KQLDatabase, or Warehouse.

path.description: A string representing the full path to the target folder within the Item. This path should be relative to the root of the OneLake directory structure. For example: 'Tables/myTablesFolder/someTableSubFolder'. String length must be at most 256. OneLake path can't start with forward slash '/'.

workspace_id.description: The ID of the target workspace.

onelake.description: An object containing the properties of the target OneLake data source.

bucket.description: Specifies the target bucket within the S3 compatible location.

connection_id.description: A string representing the connection that is bound with the shortcut. The connectionId is a unique identifier used to establish a connection between the shortcut and the target datasource.

location.description: HTTP URL of the S3 compatible endpoint. This endpoint must be able to receive ListBuckets S3 API calls. The URL must be in the non-bucket specific format; no bucket should be specified here. For example: https://s3endpoint.contoso.com.

subpath.description: Specifies a target folder or subfolder within the S3 compatible bucket. For example: /folder.

s3_compatible.description: An object containing the properties of the target S3 compatible data source.

type.description: The type object contains properties like target shortcut account type. Additional types may be added over time.

target.description: An object that contains the target datasource, and it must specify exactly one of the supported destinations: OneLake, Amazon S3, ADLS Gen2, Google Cloud Storage, S3 compatible or Dataverse.

create.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

delete.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Setting a timeout for a Delete operation is only applicable if changes are saved into state before the destroy operation occurs.

read.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Read operations occur during any refresh or planning operation when refresh is enabled.

update.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

driver_cores.description: Publication status. Value must be one of : `4`, `8`, `16`, `32`, `64`.

driver_memory.description: Spark driver memory. Value must be one of : `28g`, `56g`, `112g`, `224g`, `400g`.

enabled.description: The status of the dynamic executor allocation: `false` - Disabled, `true` - Enabled.

max_executors.description: The maximum executors. Value must be at least 1. Ensure that if an attribute is set, also these are set: "[<.min_executors]".

min_executors.description: The minimum executors. Value must be at least 1. Ensure that if an attribute is set, also these are set: "[<.max_executors]".

enabled.description: The status of the automatic log: `false` - Disabled, `true` - Enabled.

runtime_version.description: [Runtime](https://review.learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-engineering/runtime) version. Value must be one of : `1.1`, `1.2`, `1.3`.

notebook_pipeline_run_enabled.description: The status of the high concurrency for notebook pipeline run: `false` - Disabled, `true` - Enabled.

conservative_job_admission_enabled.description: Reserve maximum cores for active Spark jobs. When this setting is enabled, your Fabric capacity reserves the maximum number of cores needed for active Spark jobs, ensuring job reliability by making sure that cores are available if a job scales up. When this setting is disabled, jobs are started based on the minimum number of cores needed, letting more jobs run at the same time. `false` - Disabled, `true` - Enabled.

session_timeout_in_minutes.description: Time to terminate inactive Spark sessions. The maximum is 14 days (20160 minutes). Value must be at most 20160.

customize_compute_enabled.description: Customize compute configurations for items. `false` - Disabled, `true` - Enabled.

path.description: A string representing the full path where the shortcut is created, including either "Files" or "Tables".

connection_id.description: A string representing the connection that is bound with the shortcut. The connectionId is a unique identifier used to establish a connection between the shortcut and the target datasource. To find this connection ID, first create a cloud connection to be used by the shortcut when connecting to the ADLS data location. Open the cloud connection's Settings view and copy the connection ID; this is a GUID.

location.description: Specifies the location of the target ADLS container. The URI must be in the format https://[account-name].dfs.core.windows.net where [account-name] is the name of the target ADLS account.

subpath.description: Specifies the container and subfolder within the ADLS account where the target folder is located. Must be of the format [container]/[subfolder] where [container] is the name of the container that holds the files and folders; [subfolder] is the name of the subfolder within the container (optional). For example: /mycontainer/mysubfolder.

adls_gen2.description: An object containing the properties of the target ADLS Gen2 data source.

connection_id.description: A string representing the connection that is bound with the shortcut. The connectionId is a unique identifier used to establish a connection between the shortcut and the target datasource. To find this connection ID, first create a cloud connection to be used by the shortcut when connecting to the Amazon S3 data location. Open the cloud connection's Settings view and copy the connection ID; this is a GUID.

location.description: HTTP URL that points to the target bucket in S3. The URL should be in the format https://[bucket-name].s3.[region-code].amazonaws.com, where 'bucket-name' is the name of the S3 bucket you want to point to, and 'region-code' is the code for the region where the bucket is located. For example: https://my-s3-bucket.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com.

subpath.description: Specifies a target folder or subfolder within the S3 bucket.

amazon_s3.description: An object containing the properties of the target Amazon S3 data source.

connection_id.description: A string representing the connection that is bound with the shortcut. The connectionId is a unique identifier used to establish a connection between the shortcut and the target datasource.

location.description: HTTP URL that points to the target bucket in GCS. The URL should be in the format https://[bucket-name].storage.googleapis.com, where [bucket-name] is the name of the bucket you want to point to. For example: https://my-gcs-bucket.storage.googleapis.com.

subpath.description: Specifies a target folder or subfolder within the GCS bucket. For example: /folder.

azure_blob_storage.description: An object containing the properties of the target Google Cloud Storage data source.

connection_id.description: A string representing the connection that is bound with the shortcut. The connectionId is a unique identifier used to establish a connection between the shortcut and the target datasource. To find this connection ID, first create a cloud connection to be used by the shortcut when connecting to the Dataverse data location. Open the cloud connection's Settings view and copy the connection ID; this is a GUID.

deltalake_folder.description: Specifies the DeltaLake folder path where the target data is stored.

environment_domain.description: URI that indicates the Dataverse target environment's domain name. The URI should be formatted as 'https://[orgname].crm[xx].dynamics.com', where [orgname] represents the name of your Dataverse organization.

table_name.description: Specifies the name of the target table in Dataverse.

dataverse.description: An object containing the properties of the target Dataverse data source.

connection_id.description: A string representing the connection that is bound with the shortcut. The connectionId is a unique identifier used to establish a connection between the shortcut and the target datasource.

external_data_share.description: An object containing the properties of the target external data share.

connection_id.description: A string representing the connection that is bound with the shortcut. The connectionId is a unique identifier used to establish a connection between the shortcut and the target datasource.

location.description: HTTP URL that points to the target bucket in GCS. The URL should be in the format https://[bucket-name].storage.googleapis.com, where [bucket-name] is the name of the bucket you want to point to. For example: https://my-gcs-bucket.storage.googleapis.com.

subpath.description: Specifies a target folder or subfolder within the GCS bucket. For example: /folder.

google_cloud_storage.description: An object containing the properties of the target Google Cloud Storage data source.

item_id.description: The ID of the target in OneLake. The target can be an item of Lakehouse, KQLDatabase, or Warehouse.

path.description: A string representing the full path to the target folder within the Item. This path should be relative to the root of the OneLake directory structure. For example: 'Tables/myTablesFolder/someTableSubFolder'.

workspace_id.description: The ID of the target workspace.

onelake.description: An object containing the properties of the target OneLake data source.

bucket.description: Specifies the target bucket within the S3 compatible location.

connection_id.description: A string representing the connection that is bound with the shortcut. The connectionId is a unique identifier used to establish a connection between the shortcut and the target datasource.

location.description: HTTP URL of the S3 compatible endpoint. This endpoint must be able to receive ListBuckets S3 API calls. The URL must be in the non-bucket specific format; no bucket should be specified here. For example: https://s3endpoint.contoso.com.

subpath.description: Specifies a target folder or subfolder within the S3 compatible bucket. For example: /folder.

s3_compatible.description: An object containing the properties of the target S3 compatible data source.

type.description: The type object contains properties like target shortcut account type. Additional types may be added over time.

target.description: An object that contains the target datasource, and it must specify exactly one of the supported destinations: OneLake, Amazon S3, ADLS Gen2, Google Cloud Storage, S3 compatible or Dataverse.

read.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

block.description:
The Shortcuts data-source allows you to retrieve a list of Fabric [Shortcuts](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/onelake/onelake-shortcuts).

-> This data-source supports Service Principal authentication.

~> This data-source is in **preview**. To access it, you must explicitly enable the `preview` mode in the provider level configuration.

enabled.description: The status of the auto scale: `false` - Disabled, `true` - Enabled.
The status of the dynamic executor allocation: `false` - Disabled, `true` - Enabled.

name.description: The Spark Custom Pool ID. String length must be at most 64. The name must contain only letters, numbers, dashes, underscores and spaces.

node_family.description: The Node family. Value must be one of : `MemoryOptimized`.

node_size.description: The Node size. Value must be one of : `Large`, `Medium`, `Small`, `XLarge`, `XXLarge`.

read.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

type.description: The Spark Custom Pool type. Value must be one of : `Capacity`, `Workspace`.

conservative_job_admission_enabled.description: Reserve maximum cores for active Spark jobs. When this setting is enabled, your Fabric capacity reserves the maximum number of cores needed for active Spark jobs, ensuring job reliability by making sure that cores are available if a job scales up. When this setting is disabled, jobs are started based on the minimum number of cores needed, letting more jobs run at the same time. `false` - Disabled, `true` - Enabled.
